means: 委派代表（delegate的现在分词形式）

sentence.Network_en: Managers are constantly being told to spend more time planning and delegating.
sentence.Network_cn: 管理者经常被告知应在计划工作和授权方面多花些时间.

sentence.Network_en: The nurse uses judgement regarding individual competence when accepting and delegating responsibility.
sentence.Network_cn: 护士根据个人能力接受或授权责任.

sentence.Network_en: Once you understand this, delegating most things will be easier.
sentence.Network_cn: 一旦懂得了这点, 那么你要委派大部分事就更容易.

(4)授权型(delegating)领导(低任务一低关系)。领导者提供不多的指导或支持。

list.abs: the article put forward " 3 delegates " of serious thought additional two functions -- self-identity function , critically function , undertook an analysis to the relation of both .本文提出了“三个代表”重要思想的另两个功能——认同功能、批判功能，并对二者的关系进行了分析。

商务英语词汇大全_外语教育网 ... employer 雇主,老板 delegate 代表 representative 代表.

entry.def: A delegate is a person who is chosen to vote or make decisions on behalf of a group of other people, especially at a conference or a meeting.

entry.tran: 授(权);把(职责、责任等)委托(给)
entry.def: If you delegate duties, responsibilities, or power to someone, you give them those duties, those responsibilities, or that power so that they can act on your behalf.

example.ex: He plans to delegate more authority to his deputies...
example.tran: 他打算把更多的权力交给副手。

example.ex: How many of their activities can be safely and effectively delegated to less trained staff?...
example.tran: 他们的活动有多少可以稳妥有效地委托给那些资质稍浅的员工来进行？

entry.def: If you are delegated to do something, you are given the duty of acting on someone else's behalf by making decisions, voting, or doing some particular work.

example.ex: Officials have now been delegated to start work on a draft settlement.
example.tran: 现在已经委派官员着手起草解决方案。

means.word_mean: 1. authorizing subordinates to make certain decisions

auth_sentence.content: Because they had to rely on others to help them navigate the written word, they became adept at delegating authority.
